title: Reacţia Unei Prezentatoare Tv A Postului De Stat Din Rusia, După Victoria Ucrainei La Eurovision: „Ar Fi Nevoie De O Rachetă Satan Peste Torino”
cleaned_sentences: The Eurovision 2022 edition of Turin was won on Saturday night by Ukraine.
The country was represented by the Kalush Orchestra with the song "Stefania", which became, meanwhile, the anthem of the soldiers defending the country.
In the end, after receiving the trophy, Oleh Psiuk, the leader of the folk -rap band launched a message to support his country and to save Mariupol and those who are still in the Azovstal Combine.
Ukraine's success triggered the rage of the Russians.
", Was the exhortation of the presenter Irina Vitiazeva, who targeted the Olympic Palace in which Eurovision took place.
On this moved comment, a journalist who monitors Russian state television drew attention.
Meanwhile in Russia: Warm Wishes Tows #eurovision: - Julia Davis (@juliadavisnews) May 15, 2022 "Bomb it with a Satan Missile," Suggested Russian Journalist Yuliya Vityazeva.
pic.twitter.com/8mkbl2e6ib Ruser R-36m nuclear missiles are known in NATO terminology as "Satan".
A few days ago, according to Il Quotidiano, Vitiazeva had stated, in his talk show: "Kiev kills peaceful people in Donbas, 2014.
Now he asks for more weapons for what?
Forget about history, that everything started from there."
Follows LiveText Freedom with the latest Ukraine War information Photo: YouTube See also places to visit in Turin - the most beautiful sights!
